message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.CR 

The paper proposes a new algorithm for learning a binary classifier from positive and unlabeled data using reinforcement learning. This involves jointly optimizing the estimation of class priors or label noises and the classifier learning. The proposed method is evaluated on benchmark datasets and an e-commerce dataset, which suggests that it outperforms state-of-the-art methods in various settings. Given the focus on machine learning and optimization techniques, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning). Other possible sub-categories include cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.CV (Computer Vision), cs.CL (Computation and Language), and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
